  13. (**************************************************************************)

  15. open Local_store

  17. module STbl = Misc.Stdlib.String.Tbl

  19. (* Mapping from basenames to full filenames *)
  20. type registry = string STbl.t

  22. let files : registry ref = s_table STbl.create 42
  23. let files_uncap : registry ref = s_table STbl.create 42

  25. module Dir = struct
  26.   type t = {
  27.     path : string;
  28.     files : string list;
  29.   }

  31.   let path t = t.path
  32.   let files t = t.files

  34.   let find t fn =
  35.     if List.mem fn t.files then
  36.       Some (Filename.concat t.path fn)
  37.     else
  38.       None

  40.   let find_uncap t fn =
  41.     let fn = String.uncapitalize_ascii fn in
  42.     let search base =
  43.       if String.uncapitalize_ascii base = fn then
  44.         Some (Filename.concat t.path base)
  45.       else
  46.         None
  47.     in
  48.     List.find_map search t.files

  50.   (* For backward compatibility reason, simulate the behavior of
  51.      [Misc.find_in_path]: silently ignore directories that don't exist
  52.      + treat [""] as the current directory. *)
  53.   let readdir_compat dir =
  54.     try
  55.       Sys.readdir (if dir = "" then Filename.current_dir_name else dir)
  56.     with Sys_error _ ->
  57.       [||]

  59.   let create path =
  60.     { path; files = Array.to_list (readdir_compat path) }
  61. end

  63. ‌type auto_include_callback =
  64.   (Dir.t -> string -> string option) -> string -> string

  66. ‌let dirs = s_ref []
  67. ‌let no_auto_include _ _ = raise Not_found
  68. ‌let auto_include_callback = ref no_auto_include

  70. ‌let reset () =
  71.   assert (not Config.merlin || Local_store.is_bound ());
  72.   STbl.clear !files;
  73.   STbl.clear !files_uncap;
  74.   dirs := [];
  75.   auto_include_callback := no_auto_include

  77. ‌let get () = List.rev !dirs
  78. ‌let get_paths () = List.rev_map Dir.path !dirs

  80. (* Optimized version of [add] below, for use in [init] and [remove_dir]: since
  81.    we are starting from an empty cache, we can avoid checking whether a unit
  82.    name already exists in the cache simply by adding entries in reverse
  83.    order. *)
  84. ‌let prepend_add dir =
  85.   List.iter (fun base ->
  86.       let fn = Filename.concat dir.Dir.path base in
  87.       STbl.replace !files base fn;
  88.       STbl.replace !files_uncap (String.uncapitalize_ascii base) fn
  89.     ) dir.Dir.files

  91. let init ~auto_include l =
  92.   reset ();
  93.   dirs := List.rev_map Dir.create l;
  94.   List.iter prepend_add !dirs;
  95.   auto_include_callback := auto_include

  97. let remove_dir dir =
  98.   assert (not Config.merlin || Local_store.is_bound ());
  99.   let new_dirs = List.filter (fun d -> Dir.path d <> dir) !dirs in
  100.   if List.compare_lengths new_dirs !dirs <> 0 then begin
  101.     reset ();
  102.     List.iter prepend_add new_dirs;
  103.     dirs := new_dirs
  104.   end

  106. (* General purpose version of function to add a new entry to load path: We only
  107.    add a basename to the cache if it is not already present in the cache, in
  108.    order to enforce left-to-right precedence. *)
  109. ‌let add dir =
  110.   assert (not Config.merlin || Local_store.is_bound ());
  111.   List.iter
  112.     (fun base ->
  113.        let fn = Filename.concat dir.Dir.path base in
  114.        if not (STbl.mem !files base) then
  115.          STbl.replace !files base fn;
  116.        let ubase = String.uncapitalize_ascii base in
  117.        if not (STbl.mem !files_uncap ubase) then
  118.          STbl.replace !files_uncap ubase fn)
  119.     dir.Dir.files;
  120.   dirs := dir :: !dirs

  122. ‌let append_dir = add

  124. ‌let add_dir dir = add (Dir.create dir)

  126. (* Add the directory at the start of load path - so basenames are
  127.    unconditionally added. *)
  128. ‌let prepend_dir dir =
  129.   assert (not Config.merlin || Local_store.is_bound ());
  130.   prepend_add dir;
  131.   dirs := !dirs @ [dir]

  133. ‌let is_basename fn = Filename.basename fn = fn

  135. ‌let auto_include_libs libs alert find_in_dir fn =
  136.   let scan (lib, lazy dir) =
  137.     let file = find_in_dir dir fn in
  138.     let alert_and_add_dir _ =
  139.       alert lib;
  140.       append_dir dir
  141.     in
  142.     Option.iter alert_and_add_dir file;
  143.     file
  144.   in
  145.   match List.find_map scan libs with
  146.   | Some base -> base
  147.   | None -> raise Not_found

  149. ‌let auto_include_otherlibs =
  150.   (* Ensure directories are only ever scanned once *)
  151.   let expand = Misc.expand_directory Config.standard_library in
  152.   let otherlibs =
  153.     let read_lib lib = lazy (Dir.create (expand ("+" ^ lib))) in
  154.     List.map (fun lib -> (lib, read_lib lib)) ["dynlink"; "str"; "unix"] in
  155.   auto_include_libs otherlibs

  157. ‌let find fn =
  158.   assert (not Config.merlin || Local_store.is_bound ());
  159.   try
  160.     if is_basename fn && not !Sys.interactive then
  161.       STbl.find !files fn
  162.     else
  163.       Misc.find_in_path (get_paths ()) fn
  164.   with Not_found ->
  165.     !auto_include_callback Dir.find fn

  167. ‌let find_uncap fn =
  168.   assert (not Config.merlin || Local_store.is_bound ());
  169.   try
  170.     if is_basename fn && not !Sys.interactive then
  171.       STbl.find !files_uncap (String.uncapitalize_ascii fn)
  172.     else
  173.       Misc.find_in_path_uncap (get_paths ()) fn
  174.   with Not_found ->
  175.     let fn_uncap = String.uncapitalize_ascii fn in
  176.     !auto_include_callback Dir.find_uncap fn_uncap
